project.name: SmugMug YUI Gallery API docs
project.description: Kickass gallery modules courtesy of your pals at SmugMug.

dom-form-values.name: dom-form-values
dom-form-values.description:
Adds a `Y.DOM.formToObject(identifier)` method to extract the values from a
`<form>` element and return an object map of element name to value(s).

gallery-sm-editor.name: gallery-sm-editor
gallery-sm-editor.description: Provides `Y.Editor`, a simple but powerful WYSIWYG editor.

gallery-sm-editor-base.name: gallery-sm-editor-base
gallery-sm-editor-base.description: Provides `Y.Editor.Base`, the core implementation of the SmugMug editor.

gallery-sm-focusmanager.name: gallery-sm-focusmanager
gallery-sm-focusmanager.description:
Provides the FocusManager Node plugin, which makes it easy to manage keyboard
focus among the descendants of a node.

gallery-sm-selection.name: gallery-sm-selection
gallery-sm-selection.description:
Provides the `Selection` class, which normalizes text selection functionality
across browsers.

gallery-sm-range.name: gallery-sm-range
gallery-sm-range.description: Provides the `Range` class, which normalizes Range behavior across browsers.

Editor.Keys.name: Editor.Keys
Editor.Keys.description:
Extension for `Editor.Base` that adds support for configurable keyboard
shortcuts, including a set of default shortcuts.

Editor.Undo.name: Editor.Undo
Editor.Undo.description:
Extension for `Editor.Base` that adds a cross-browser undo/redo stack.

When mixed into an editor that also mixes in the `Editor.Keys` extension, handy
undo/redo keyboard shortcuts and triggers will be added as well.

Editor.Base.name: Editor.Base
Editor.Base.description:
Base implementation of the SmugMug editor. Provides core editor functionality,
but no undo stack, keyboard shortcuts, etc.

Editor.name: Editor
Editor.description: A simple but powerful WYSIWYG editor.

Plugin.FocusManager.name: Plugin.FocusManager

Plugin.Menu.name: Plugin.Menu

props.name: items
props.description:
Array of `Menu.Item` instances
        or menu item config objects to add to this menu.

Menu.Item.name: Menu.Item
Menu.Item.description: Represents a single menu item in a `Menu`.

params.name: menu
params.description: `Menu` instance with which this node should be associated.

params.name: config
params.description:
Configuration hash for this menu item. Supports all the
    config properties of `Tree.Node` in addition to the following.

props.name: state
props.description: State hash for this menu item.

props.name: disabled
props.description:
If `true`, this menu item
            will be disabled, and will not be clickable or selectable.

props.name: hidden
props.description:
If `true`, this menu item
            will be hidden.

props.name: type
props.description:
Type of this menu item. May be 'item',
        'heading', or 'separator'.

props.name: url
props.description:
URL associated with this item. If this item
        is of type 'item', clicking on the item will navigate to this URL.

props.name: sourceNode
props.description:
Node instance, HTML
    element, or selector string for a node (usually a `<ul>` or `<ol>`) whose
    structure should be parsed and used to generate this menu's contents. This
    node will be removed from the DOM after being parsed.

Range.name: Range
Range.description:
Provides a friendly cross-browser Range API similar to the API defined in the
DOM Range specification.

params.name: range
params.description:
Native Range object to wrap. If not provided, a
    new Range will be created.

Selection.name: Selection
Selection.description: Normalizes text selection functionality across browsers.

classitems.description:
Return an object with form values from `<input>`s, `<select>`s, and
`<textarea>`s, keyed by field name. Fields with multiple values will have those
values in an array.

* Disabled fields will be ignored unless the _includeDisabled_ param is truthy.
* If no radio or checkbox is checked, the returned object will not contain a
    reference to it.
* If no option is selected in a single select, the first option value will be
    used.
* if no option is selected in a multi-select, it will be omitted from the
    returned object.
classitems.name: formToObject

params.name: identifier
params.description:
The DOM element, Node, or selector for
                                the `<form>`

classitems.description:
Hash of keyCode values that should be ignored when processing keyboard
events.

This is used to avoid double-handling of modifier keys, since other event
properties are used to detect whether modifier keys are pressed.
classitems.name: ignoreKeyCodes

classitems.description: Mapping of keyCode values to friendly names for special keys.
classitems.name: keyCodeMap

classitems.description: Mapping of shortcut keys to function handlers.
classitems.name: keyCommands

classitems.description: Attaches keyboard events.
classitems.name: _attachKeyEvents

classitems.description: Detaches keyboard events.
classitems.name: _detachKeyEvents

classitems.description: Handles `keydown` events on this editor.
classitems.name: _onKeyDown

classitems.description: Key commands related to undo/redo functionality.
classitems.name: undoKeyCommands

classitems.description: Array of redoable changes that have previously been undone.
classitems.name: _redoStack

classitems.description: Array of undoable changes that have been made to this editor.
classitems.name: _undoStack

classitems.description: Redoes the last change that was undone in this editor.
classitems.name: redo

classitems.description: Undoes the last change made in this editor.
classitems.name: undo

classitems.description:
Adds an entry to the undo stack representing the current state of the
editor.
classitems.name: _addUndo

classitems.description:
Adds an entry to the redo stack representing the current state of the
editor.
classitems.name: _addRedo

classitems.description: Attaches undo events.
classitems.name: _attachUndoEvents

classitems.description: Wrapper for `Editor.Base#_execCommand()`.
classitems.name: _beforeExecCommand

classitems.description: Detaches undo events.
classitems.name: _detachUndoEvents

classitems.description: Handles editor `render` events.
classitems.name: _afterRender

classitems.description:
Number of undo/redo levels to maintain. Lowering this number may reduce
memory usage, especially when editing very large documents.
classitems.name: undoLevels

classitems.description: Fired after this editor loses focus.
classitems.name: blur

classitems.description: Fired after this editor receives focus.
classitems.name: focus

classitems.description: Fired after this editor is rendered.
classitems.name: render

classitems.description: Fired when this editor's selection changes.
classitems.name: selectionChange

params.name: prevRange
params.description:
Range that was previously selected, or `null` if there
    was no previous selection.

params.name: range
params.description:
Range that's now selected, or `null` if the current
    selection is empty or outside the editor.

params.name: selection
params.description: Reference to this editor's Selection instance.

classitems.description: CSS class names used by this editor.
classitems.name: classNames

subprops.name: cursor
subprops.description:
Class name used for a placeholder node that
    represents the cursor position.

subprops.name: editor
subprops.description: Class name used for the editor's container.

subprops.name: input
subprops.description:
Class name used for the WYSIWYG YUI Editor frame that
    will receive user input.

classitems.description:
`Y.Selection` instance representing the current document selection.

The selection object's state always reflects the current selection, so it
will update when the selection changes. If you need to retain the state of a
past selection, hold onto a Range instance representing that selection.

Also, beware: this selection object reflects the current selection in the
entire browser document, not just within this editor.
classitems.name: selection

classitems.description:
Hash of style commands supported by this editor.

Names should correspond with valid `execCommand()` command names. Values
should be strings specifying the style's type: either 'boolean' or 'string'.
classitems.name: styleCommands

classitems.description: Removes focus from this editor.
classitems.name: blur

classitems.description: Bolds or unbolds the current selection.
classitems.name: bold

classitems.description:
Gets and/or sets the value of the specified editor command.

See <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Rich-Text_Editing_in_Mozilla>
for a list of possible commands.
classitems.name: command

params.name: value
params.description:
Command value. Use the special value
    'toggle' to toggle a boolean command (like 'bold') to the opposite of
    its current state.

return.description: Value of the specified command.

classitems.description: Decreases the font size of the current selection (if possible).
classitems.name: decreaseFontSize

classitems.description: Focuses this editor.
classitems.name: focus

classitems.description: Increases the font size of the current selection (if possible).
classitems.name: increaseFontSize

classitems.description:
Inserts the specified _html_ at the current selection point, deleting the
current selection if there is one.
classitems.name: insertHTML

params.name: html
params.description:
HTML to insert, in the form of an HTML
    string, HTMLElement, or Node instance.

return.description: Node instance representing the inserted HTML.

classitems.description:
Inserts the specified plain _text_ at the current selection point, deleting
the current selection if there is one.
classitems.name: insertText

return.description: Node instance representing the inserted text node.

classitems.description: Italicizes or unitalicizes the current selection.
classitems.name: italic

classitems.description:
Renders this editor into its container and appends the container to the
document if necessary.
classitems.name: render

classitems.description:
Gets and/or sets the value of the specified editor style command. This
method is similar to `command()`, but only supports a subset of
style-related commands.

See the `styleCommands` property for a list of supported style commands.
classitems.name: style

params.name: value
params.description:
Command value. Use the special value
    'toggle' to toggle a boolean command (like 'bold') to the opposite of
    its current state.

return.description: Value of the specified command.

classitems.description:
Gets and/or sets the values of multiple editor style commands.

When called without an argument, the current values of all supported style
commands will be returned. When called with a _styles_ object, the specified
style commands will be set to their given values, and the resulting new
values will be returned.
classitems.name: styles

params.name: styles
params.description: Hash of style names and values to set.

return.description:
Hash of style names and values that were set, or all styles
    if no _styles_ parameter was specified.

classitems.description: Toggles underline on the current selection.
classitems.name: underline

classitems.description: Attaches editor events.
classitems.name: _attachEvents

classitems.description: Detaches editor events.
classitems.name: _detachEvents

classitems.description:
Wrapper for native the native `execCommand()` that verifies that the command
is valid in the current state and normalizes boolean/toggleable values.
classitems.name: _execCommand

classitems.description: Getter for the `html` attribute.
classitems.name: _getHTML

return.description: HTML.

classitems.description: Getter for the `text` attribute.
classitems.name: _getText

return.description: Text.

classitems.description:
Inserts a `<span>` at the current selection point containing a preformatted
tab character.
classitems.name: _insertTab

classitems.description:
Wrapper for the native `queryCommandState()` and `queryCommandValue()`
methods that uses the appropriate method for the given command type.
classitems.name: _queryCommandValue

return.description: Command value.

classitems.description: Setter for the `html` attribute.
classitems.name: _setHTML

return.description: HTML.

classitems.description: Setter for the `text` attribute.
classitems.name: _setText

return.description: Text.

classitems.description:
Refreshes the editor's internal knowledge of the current document selection
state and fires a `selectionChange` event if the selection has changed since
it was last refreshed.
classitems.name: _updateSelection

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the `selectionChange`
        event will be suppressed.

classitems.description: Handles `blur` events on the editor.
classitems.name: _onBlur

classitems.description: Handles `focus` events on the editor.
classitems.name: _onFocus

classitems.description: Handles `paste` events on the editor.
classitems.name: _onPaste

classitems.description: HTML content of this editor.
classitems.name: html

classitems.description:
Form field name to use for the hidden `<textarea>` that contains the raw
output of the editor in the configured output format. This name will
only be used if the output node doesn't already have a name when the
editor is rendered.

You may need to customize this if you plan to use the editor in a form
that will be submitted to a server.
classitems.name: outputName

classitems.description: Text content of this editor, with no HTML.
classitems.name: text

classitems.description:
Mapping of key codes to friendly key names that can be used in the `keys`
attribute and the `preventDefaultMap` property.
classitems.name: keyCodeMap

classitems.description:
Mapping of keys whose default actions should be prevented when they trigger
a FocusManager action.
classitems.name: preventDefaultMap

classitems.description:
Focuses and returns the nearest ancestor item that contains the current
`activeItem`, if any.
classitems.name: ascend

return.description: Focused node, or `null` if there is no ancestor item.

classitems.description:
Focuses and returns the first descendant item within the current
`activeItem`, if any. In order for this to have any effect, a
`containerSelector` must be set.
classitems.name: descend

return.description: Focused node, or `null` if there is no descendant item.

classitems.description: Focuses and returns the first focusable item.
classitems.name: first

props.name: container
props.description:
Descendant container to restrict the
        search to. Defaults to the host node.

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the item will be
        returned, but will not become the active item.

return.description: Focused node, or `null` if there are no focusable items.

classitems.description: Focuses and returns the last focusable item.
classitems.name: last

props.name: container
props.description:
Descendant container to restrict the
        search to. Defaults to the host node.

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the item will be
        returned, but will not become the active item.

return.description: Focused node, or `null` if there are no focusable items.

classitems.description:
Focuses and returns the next focusable sibling of the current `activeItem`.

If there is no focusable next sibling and the `circular` attribute is
`false`, the current `activeItem` will be returned.
classitems.name: next

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the item will be
        returned, but will not become the active item.

return.description: Focused node, or `null` if there is no `activeItem`.

classitems.description:
Focuses and returns the previous focusable sibling of the current
`activeItem`.

If there is no focusable previous sibling and the `circular` attribute is
`false`, the current `activeItem` will be returned.
classitems.name: previous

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the item will be
        returned, but will not become the active item.

return.description: Focused node, or `null` if there is no `activeItem`.

classitems.description:
Refreshes the `tabIndex` state of this FocusManager's items to ensure that
items are focusable but only the currently active item is in the tab flow.

Call this method after adding, disabling, or enabling elements to ensure
that they're managed correctly.
classitems.name: refresh

params.name: container
params.description:
If specified, only items that are direct
    descendants of this container will be refreshed.

classitems.description: Attaches event handlers.
classitems.name: _attachEvents

classitems.description: Detaches event handlers.
classitems.name: _detachEvents

classitems.description: Returns the container node for the current `activeItem`.
classitems.name: _getActiveContainer

return.description: Container node for the current `activeItem`.

classitems.description: Getter for the `anchoredContainerSelector` attribute.
classitems.name: _getAnchoredContainerSelector

classitems.description: Getter for the `anchoredItemSelector` attribute.
classitems.name: _getAnchoredItemSelector

classitems.description: Handles `activeItemChange` events.
classitems.name: _afterActiveItemChange

classitems.description: Handles `blur` events on the host node.
classitems.name: _afterBlur

classitems.description: Handles `focus` events on the host node.
classitems.name: _afterFocus

classitems.description: Handles `keydown` events on the host node.
classitems.name: _onKeyDown

classitems.description:
Node that's currently either focused or focusable as part of the
document's tab flow.
classitems.name: activeItem

classitems.description:
Anchored version of `containerSelector`.

For example, if `containerSelector` is set to "ul", then
`anchoredContainerSelector` will default to ">ul". You can override the
default by specifying your own anchored selector if desired.
classitems.name: anchoredContainerSelector

classitems.description:
Anchored version of `itemSelector`.

For example, if `itemSelector` is set to "li", then
`anchoredItemSelector` will default to ">li". You can override the
default by specifying your own anchored selector if desired.
classitems.name: anchoredItemSelector

classitems.description:
If `true`, focus will wrap around to the first or last item in the
current container when the selection moves past the end or beginning of
the focusable items, respectively.
classitems.name: circular

classitems.description:
Non-anchored CSS selector that matches a hierarchical descendant
container into which focus can descend.

For example, if the host node is a `<ul>` and item nodes are `<li>`s,
setting `containerSelector` to "ul" would allow the user to descend into
a nested `<ul>` contained inside an `<li>`.

To prevent hierarchical selection, set `containerSelector` to `null`
(the default).
classitems.name: containerSelector

classitems.description:
Non-anchored CSS selector that matches nodes that should be considered
disabled. Disabled nodes will not be considered focusable.

By default, a node is considered disabled if it has a `disabled`
attribute or an `aria-disabled` or `aria-hidden` attribute set to
"true".
classitems.name: disabledSelector

classitems.description:
`true` if the host node or one of its focusable items is currently
focused, `false` otherwise.
classitems.name: focused

classitems.description:
Non-anchored CSS selector that matches item nodes that should be
focusable.
classitems.name: itemSelector

classitems.description:
Mapping of keyboard codes to functions or function names that should
execute when those keys are pressed.

By default, the following keys are mapped:

* down arrow: `next()`
* left arrow: `ascend()`
* right arrow: `descend()`
* up arrow: `previous()`

To customize the mapping, either modify or replace the `keys` object.

Values should be functions or strings representing named functions on
this FocusManager instance. All functions will be executed with this
FocusManager as the `this` object.

Properties should be numerical key codes or one of the following
strings representing a key on the keyboard:

* down
* end
* home
* left
* pgdown
* pgup
* right
* space
* up
classitems.name: keys

classitems.description:
Repositions this menu so that it is anchored to a specified node, region, or
set of pixel coordinates.

The menu will be displayed at the most advantageous position relative to the
anchor point to ensure that as much of the menu as possible is visible
within the viewport.

If no anchor point is specified, the menu will be positioned relative to its
host node.
classitems.name: reposition

params.name: anchorPoint
params.description:
Anchor point at which this menu
    should be positioned. The point may be specified as a `Y.Node`
    reference, a region object, or an array of X and Y pixel coordinates.

classitems.description:
Returns an efficient test function that can be passed to `Y.Node#ancestor()`
to test whether a node is this menu's container or its plugin host.

This is broken out to make overriding easier in subclasses.
classitems.name: _getAncestorTestFn

return.description: Test function.

classitems.description:
If `true`, this menu will be shown when the host node is clicked with
the left mouse button or (in the case of `<button>`, `<input>`, and
`<a>` elements) activated with the Return key.
classitems.name: showOnClick

classitems.description:
If `true`, this menu will be shown when the host node's `contextmenu`
event occurs, which happens when the user takes an action that would
normally display the browser's context menu (such as right-clicking).

When `true`, the browser's default context menu will be prevented from
appearing.
classitems.name: showOnContext

classitems.description:
If `true`, this menu will be shown when the host node is hovered or
receives focus instead of only being shown when it's clicked.
classitems.name: showOnHover

classitems.description: Fired when a menu item is disabled.
classitems.name: disable

classitems.description: Fired when a menu item is enabled.
classitems.name: enable

classitems.description: Fired when a menu item is hidden.
classitems.name: hide

classitems.description: Fired when a menu item is shown.
classitems.name: show

classitems.description: Closes all open submenus of this menu.
classitems.name: closeSubMenus

classitems.description: Disables the specified menu item.
classitems.name: disableItem

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the `disable` event
        will be suppressed.

classitems.description: Enables the specified menu item.
classitems.name: enableItem

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the `enable` event
        will be suppressed.

classitems.description: Hides the specified menu item.
classitems.name: hideItem

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the `hide` event
        will be suppressed.

classitems.description: Shows the specified menu item.
classitems.name: showItem

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the `show` event
        will be suppressed.

classitems.description: Default handler for the `disable` event.
classitems.name: _defDisableFn

classitems.description: Default handler for the `enable` event.
classitems.name: _defEnableFn

classitems.description: Default handler for the `hide` event.
classitems.name: _defHideFn

classitems.description: Default handler for the `show` event.
classitems.name: _defShowFn

classitems.description: Disables this menu item. Disabled items are not clickable or selectable.
classitems.name: disable

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the `disable` event
        will be suppressed.

classitems.description: Enables this menu item.
classitems.name: enable

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the `enable` event
        will be suppressed.

classitems.description: Hides this menu item.
classitems.name: hide

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the `hide` event
        will be suppressed.

classitems.description:
Returns `true` if this menu item or one of its ancestors is currently
disabled.
classitems.name: isDisabled

return.description:
`true` if this menu item or one of its ancestors is
    currently disabled, `false` otherwise.

classitems.description:
Returns `true` if this menu item or one of its ancestors is currently
hidden.
classitems.name: isHidden

return.description:
`true` if this menu item or one of its ancestors is
    currently hidden, `false` otherwise.

classitems.description: Shows this menu item.
classitems.name: show

props.name: silent
props.description:
If `true`, the `show` event
        will be suppressed.

classitems.description:
Fired when any clickable menu item is clicked.

You can subscribe to clicks on a specific menu item by subscribing to
"itemClick#id", where "id" is the item id of the item you want to subscribe to.
classitems.name: itemClick

classitems.description: CSS class names used by this menu.
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description: Whether or not this menu has been rendered.
classitems.name: rendered

classitems.description:
Selectors to use when parsing a menu structure from a DOM structure via
`parseHTML()`.
classitems.name: sourceSelectors

classitems.description:
Returns the HTML node (as a `Y.Node` instance) associated with the specified
menu item, if any.
classitems.name: getHTMLNode

return.description:
`Y.Node` instance associated with the given tree node, or
    `undefined` if one was not found.

classitems.description: Hides this menu.
classitems.name: hide

classitems.description:
Parses the specified HTML _sourceNode_ as a menu structure and returns an
array of menu item objects that can be used to generate a menu with that
structure.

By default, _sourceNode_ is expected to contain one `<li>` element per
menu item, and submenus are expected to be represented by `<ul>` or `<ol>`
elements.

The selector queries used to parse the menu structure are contained in the
`sourceSelectors` property, and may be customized. Class names specified in
the `classNames` property are used to determine whether a menu item should
be disabled, hidden, or treated as a heading or separator.
classitems.name: parseHTML

params.name: sourceNode
params.description:
Node instance, HTML element, or
    selector string for the node (usually a `<ul> or `<ol>` element) to
    parse.

return.description: Array of menu item objects.

classitems.description:
Renders this menu into its container.

If the container hasn't already been added to the current document, it will
be appended to the `<body>` element.
classitems.name: render

classitems.description:
Renders the children of the specified menu item.

If a container is specified, it will be assumed to be an existing rendered
menu item, and the children will be rendered (or re-rendered) inside it.
classitems.name: renderChildren

params.name: menuItem
params.description: Menu item whose children should be rendered.

props.name: container
props.description:
`Y.Node` instance of a container into
        which the children should be rendered. If the container already
        contains rendered children, they will be re-rendered in place.

return.description: `Y.Node` instance containing the rendered children.

classitems.description:
Renders the specified menu item and its children (if any).

If a container is specified, the rendered node will be appended to it.
classitems.name: renderNode

props.name: container
props.description:
`Y.Node` instance of a container to
        which the rendered tree node should be appended.

props.name: renderChildren
props.description:
Whether or not to render
        this node's children.

return.description: `Y.Node` instance of the rendered menu item.

classitems.description:
Repositions this menu so that it is anchored to a specified node, region, or
set of pixel coordinates.

The menu will be displayed at the most advantageous position relative to the
anchor point to ensure that as much of the menu as possible is visible
within the viewport.
classitems.name: reposition

params.name: anchorPoint
params.description:
Anchor point at which this menu
    should be positioned. The point may be specified as a `Y.Node`
    reference, a region object, or an array of X and Y pixel coordinates.

classitems.description:
Shows this menu.

The menu will be rendered if it hasn't been rendered already.
classitems.name: show

props.name: anchorPoint
props.description:
Anchor point at
        which this menu should be positioned when shown. The point may be
        specified as a `Y.Node` reference, a region object, or an array of X
        and Y pixel coordinates.

classitems.description:
Toggles the visibility of this menu, showing it if it's currently hidden or
hiding it if it's currently visible.
classitems.name: toggleVisible

props.name: anchorPoint
props.description:
Anchor point at
        which this menu should be positioned when shown. The point may be
        specified as a `Y.Node` reference, a region object, or an array of X
        and Y pixel coordinates.

classitems.description: Attaches menu events.
classitems.name: _attachMenuEvents

classitems.description: Detaches menu events.
classitems.name: _detachMenuEvents

classitems.description:
Returns an efficient test function that can be passed to `Y.Node#ancestor()`
to test whether a node is this menu's container.

This is broken out to make overriding easier in subclasses.
classitems.name: _getAncestorTestFn

return.description: Test function.

classitems.description:
Given an anchor point and the regions currently occupied by a child node
(the node being anchored) and a parent node (the node being anchored to),
returns a region object representing the coordinates the anchored node will
occupy when anchored to the given point on the parent.

An anchor point is a string like "tl-bl", which means "anchor the top left
point of _nodeRegion_ to the bottom left point of _parentRegion_".

Any combination of top/bottom/left/right anchor points may be used as long
as they follow this format. Here are a few examples:

  * `'bl-br'`: Anchor the bottom left of _nodeRegion_ to the bottom right of
    _parentRegion_.
  * `'br-bl'`: Anchor the bottom right of _nodeRegion_ to the bottom left of
    _parentRegion_.
  * `'tl-tr'`: Anchor the top left of _nodeRegion_ to the top right of
    _parentRegion_.
  * `'tr-tl'`: Anchor the top right of _nodeRegion_ to the top left of
    _parentRegion_.
classitems.name: _getAnchorRegion

params.name: anchor
params.description: Anchor point. See above for details.

params.name: nodeRegion
params.description:
Region object for the node to be anchored (that
    is, the node that will be repositioned).

params.name: parentRegion
params.description:
Region object for the node that will be
    anchored to (that is, the node that will not move).

return.description: Region that will be occupied by the anchored node.

classitems.description: Hides the specified menu container by moving its htmlNode offscreen.
classitems.name: _hideMenu

params.name: htmlNode
params.description: HTML node for the menu item.

classitems.description:
Returns `true` if the given _inner_ region is contained entirely within the
given _outer_ region. If it's not a perfect fit, returns a numerical score
indicating how much of the _inner_ region fits within the _outer_ region.
A higher score indicates a better fit.
classitems.name: _inRegion

return.description:
`true` if the _inner_ region fits entirely within
    the _outer_ region or, if not, a numerical score indicating how much of
    the inner region fits.

classitems.description:
Intelligently positions the _htmlNode_ of the given submenu _item_ relative
to its parent so that as much as possible of the submenu will be visible
within the viewport.
classitems.name: _positionMenu

params.name: htmlNode
params.description: HTML node for the menu item.

classitems.description: Handles `add` events for this menu.
classitems.name: _afterAdd

classitems.description: Handles `clear` events for this menu.
classitems.name: _afterClear

classitems.description: Handles `mousedown` events on the document.
classitems.name: _afterDocMouseDown

classitems.description: Handles `close` events for this menu.
classitems.name: _afterClose

classitems.description: Handles `disable` events for this menu.
classitems.name: _afterDisable

classitems.description: Handles `enable` events for this menu.
classitems.name: _afterEnable

classitems.description: Handles `hide` events for this menu.
classitems.name: _afterHide

classitems.description: Handles `open` events for this menu.
classitems.name: _afterOpen

classitems.description: Handles `orientationChange` events for this menu.
classitems.name: _afterOrientationChange

classitems.description: Handles `remove` events for this menu.
classitems.name: _afterRemove

classitems.description: Handles `show` events for this menu.
classitems.name: _afterShow

classitems.description: Handles `visibleChange` events for this menu.
classitems.name: _afterVisibleChange

classitems.description: Handles click events on menu items.
classitems.name: _onItemClick

classitems.description: Handles delegated `mouseenter` events on menu items.
classitems.name: _onItemMouseEnter

classitems.description: Handles delegated `mouseleave` events on menu items.
classitems.name: _onItemMouseLeave

classitems.description: Handles `mouseenter` events on this menu.
classitems.name: _onMenuMouseEnter

classitems.description: Handles `mouseleave` events on this menu.
classitems.name: _onMenuMouseLeave

classitems.description: Default handler for the generic `itemClick` event.
classitems.name: _defItemClickFn

classitems.description: Default handler for item-specific `itemClick#<id>` events.
classitems.name: _defSpecificItemClickFn

classitems.description:
Preferred alignment positions at which this menu should be displayed
relative to the anchor point when one is provided to the `show()`,
`toggle()`, or `reposition()` methods.

The most optimal alignment position will be chosen automatically based
on which one allows the most of this menu to be visible within the
browser's viewport. If multiple positions are equally visible, then the
optimal position will be chosen based on its order in this array.

An alignment position is a string like "tl-bl", which means "align the
top left of this menu to the bottom left of its anchor point".

Any combination of top/bottom/left/right alignment positions may be used
as long as they follow this format. Here are a few examples:

  * `'bl-br'`: Align the bottom left of this menu with the bottom right
    of the anchor point.
  * `'br-bl'`: Align the bottom right of this menu with the bottom left
    of the anchor point.
  * `'tl-tr'`: Align the top left of this menu with the top right of
    the anchor point.
  * `'tr-tl'`: Align the top right of this menu to the top left of this
    anchor point.
classitems.name: alignments

classitems.description:
If `true`, this menu will be hidden when the user clicks on a menu item
that doesn't contain a submenu.
classitems.name: hideOnClick

classitems.description:
If `true`, this menu will be hidden when the user moves the mouse
outside the menu.
classitems.name: hideOnMouseLeave

classitems.description:
If `true`, this menu will be hidden when the user clicks somewhere
outside the menu.
classitems.name: hideOnOutsideClick

classitems.description: Orientation of this menu. May be either `'vertical'` or `'horizontal'`.
classitems.name: orientation

classitems.description:
Just like `alignments`, but for submenus of this menu. See the
`alignments` attribute for details on how alignment positions work.
classitems.name: subMenuAlignments

classitems.description:
Whether or not this menu is visible. Changing this attribute's value
will also change the visibility of this menu.
classitems.name: visible

classitems.description:
Returns a new Range object with the same boundary points as this range.

The returned Range is a copy, not a reference, so modifying it will not
affect this range (and vice versa).
classitems.name: clone

return.description:
New Range object with the same boundary points as this
    range.

classitems.description:
Returns a Node instance containing a document fragment with a copy of this
range's contents.

Event listeners are not copied.

Element ids _are_ copied. This could lead to duplicate ids, so be careful.

Partially selected nodes will include parent tags to ensure that the
fragment is valid.
classitems.name: cloneContents

return.description:
Node instance containing a document fragment with a copy of
    this range's contents.

classitems.description:
Collapses this range by setting the start and end points to the same
position, thus resulting in an empty range.
classitems.name: collapse

props.name: toStart
props.description:
If `true`, this range will be
        collapsed by moving the end point to the start point. Otherwise, the
        start point will be moved to the end point.

classitems.description:
Compares the start or end boundary of this range with the start or end
boundary of another range.
classitems.name: compare

props.name: myPoint
props.description:
Specifies which boundary point
        on this range should be used for the comparison. Valid values are
        'start' to use this range's start point for the comparison, or 'end'
        to use this range's end point.

props.name: otherPoint
props.description:
Specifies which boundary
        point on _otherRange_ should be used for the comparison. Valid
        values are 'start' to use _otherRange_'s start point for the
        comparison, or 'end' to use _otherRange_'s end point.

return.description:
-1, 0, or 1, indicating whether this range's boundary is
    respectively before, equal to, or after the other range's boundary.

classitems.description: Removes the contents of this range from the DOM.
classitems.name: deleteContents

classitems.description:
Gets or sets the node that contains the end point of this range.

When specifying an _offset_, you may specify either a number or the string
"before" or "after".

A numerical offset will position the end point at that offset inside the
_node_. If _node_ is a text node, the offset will represent a character
position. If _node_ can contain child nodes, then the offset will represent
a child index.

The offset "before" will cause the end point to be placed immediately before
_node_ (not inside it).

The offset "after" will cause the end point to be placed immediately after
_node_ (not inside it).
classitems.name: endNode

params.name: node
params.description:
Node to set the end point to. May be
    specified as a Node instance, HTMLElement, or selector string. If not
    specified, the current end point will be returned.

params.name: offset
params.description:
Offset position of the new end point
    relative to the _node_. If this is a number, it will be used as an
    offset position inside _node_. To specify a position immediately before
    _node_, use the string "before". To specify a position immediately after
    _node_, use the string "after".

return.description: Node that contains the end point of this range.

classitems.description:
Gets or sets the offset of this selection's end position inside the end
node.

If the end node is a text node, the offset represents a character position.
If the end node can contain child nodes, then the offset represents a child
index.

When setting an offset, you may use a numerical offset (which behaves as
described above) or the string "before" or "after".

The offset "before" will cause the end point to be placed immediately before
the current end node (not inside it).

The offset "after" will cause the end point to be placed immediately after
the current end node (not inside it).

Note that setting a "before" or "after" offset will change the end node. To
get the new end node, call `endNode()`.
classitems.name: endOffset

params.name: offset
params.description:
Offset position of the new end point
    relative to the current end node. If this is a number, it will be used
    as an offset position inside the node. To specify a position immediately
    before the node, use the string "before". To specify a position
    immediately after the node, use the string "after".

return.description:
Offset of this selection's end position inside the end
    node.

classitems.description:
Moves this range's contents into a document fragment and returns a Node
instance containing that fragment.

Event listeners are not retained.

If this range splits a non-text element, the resulting fragment will include
a clone of that element, including its id (if it has one). This could lead
to duplicate ids, so be careful.
classitems.name: extractContents

return.description:
Node instance containing a document fragment with this
    range's contents.

classitems.description: Inserts a node at the start of this range.
classitems.name: insertNode

params.name: node
params.description:
Node instance, HTMLElement, or
    selector string of a node to insert.

return.description: Inserted node.

classitems.description:
Returns `true` if this range is collapsed, `false` otherwise.

A `true` value means that the start and end points are the same and the
range is empty, whereas a `false` value means that the start and end points
are different and the range is not empty.
classitems.name: isCollapsed

return.description: `true` if this range is collapsed, `false` otherwise.

classitems.description:
Returns `true` if this range has the same boundaries as _otherRange_,
`false` otherwise.
classitems.name: isEquivalent

params.name: otherRange
params.description: Range to compare this range to.

return.description:
`true` if this range has the same boundaries as
    _otherRange_, `false` otherwise.

classitems.description: Returns `true` if this range is entirely contained within the given _node_.
classitems.name: isInsideNode

params.name: node
params.description:
Node instance, HTML element, or
    selector string of the container.

return.description:
`true` if this range is entirely contained within the
    given _node_, `false` otherwise.

classitems.description:
Returns the nearest common ancestor node that fully contains all nodes
within this range.
classitems.name: parentNode

return.description:
Nearest common ancestor node that fully contains all nodes
    within this range.

classitems.description:
Gets or sets the node that contains the start point of this range.

When specifying an _offset_, you may specify either a number or the string
"before" or "after".

A numerical offset will position the start point at that offset inside the
_node_. If _node_ is a text node, the offset will represent a character
position. If _node_ can contain child nodes, then the offset will represent
a child index.

The offset "before" will cause the start point to be placed immediately
before _node_ (not inside it).

The offset "after" will cause the start point to be placed immediately after
_node_ (not inside it).
classitems.name: startNode

params.name: node
params.description:
Node to set the start point to. May
    be specified as a Node instance, HTMLElement, or selector string. If not
    specified, the current start point will be returned.

params.name: offset
params.description:
Offset position of the new start point
    relative to the _node_. If this is a number, it will be used as an
    offset position inside _node_. To specify a position immediately before
    _node_, use the string "before". To specify a position immediately after
    _node_, use the string "after".

return.description: Node that contains the start point of this range.

classitems.description:
Gets or sets the offset of this range's start position inside the start
node.

If the start node is a text node, the offset represents a character
position. If the start node can contain child nodes, then the offset
represents a child index.

When setting an offset, you may use a numerical offset (which behaves as
described above) or the string "before" or "after".

The offset "before" will cause the start point to be placed immediately
before the current start node (not inside it).

The offset "after" will cause the start point to be placed immediately after
the current start node (not inside it).

Note that setting a "before" or "after" offset will change the start node.
To get the new start node, call `startNode()`.
classitems.name: startOffset

params.name: offset
params.description:
Offset position of the new start point
    relative to the current start node. If this is a number, it will be used
    as an offset position inside the node. To specify a position immediately
    before the node, use the string "before". To specify a position
    immediately after the node, use the string "after".

return.description:
Offset of this range's start position inside the start
    node.

classitems.description: Returns the HTML content of this range.
classitems.name: toHTML

return.description: HTML content of this range.

classitems.description: Returns the plain text content of this range.
classitems.name: toString

return.description: Plain text content of this range.

classitems.description: Traverses the contents of the range, passing each node and its children to the supplied callback in document order. For example, if the range includes the following HTML... lorem ipsum dolor sit amet ...then this `traverse()` call... range.traverse(function (node) { console.log(Y.Node.getDOMNode(node)); }); ...would result in the following console output: "lorem ipsum " element "dolor " element "sit" " amet" The entire start and end node will be included even if the range only includes a portion of them. Use the `startOffset()` and `endOffset()` methods to determine where the precise boundaries are if necessary.
classitems.name: traverse

props.name: node
props.description: Node instance.

params.name: thisObj
params.description:
`this` object to use when calling the callback
    function.

classitems.description: Wraps this range in the specified HTML and returns the new wrapper node.
classitems.name: wrap

props.name: includeWrapper
props.description:
If `true`, this range
        will be updated to include the new wrapper node.

return.description: New wrapper node.

classitems.description:
Returns the `Range` instance at the specified _index_, or the first range in
this selection if no index is specified. If no ranges are selected, returns
`null`.
classitems.name: range

return.description:
Range instance at the specified _index_, or the first range
    in this selection if no index is specified. If no ranges are selected,
    returns `null`.

classitems.description: Returns an array containing all the ranges in this selection.
classitems.name: ranges

return.description: Array containing all the ranges in this selection.

classitems.description:
Selects the specified _range_.

By default, this will result in only this range being selected. If
`options.multi` is truthy, then the _range_ will be added to the current
selection without first unselecting any other selected ranges.
classitems.name: select

props.name: multi
props.description:
If `true`, the specified _range_
        will be added to the current list of selected ranges instead of
        replacing the current selection.

classitems.description:
Removes the specified _range_ from this selection, or unselects all ranges
if no _range_ is specified.
classitems.name: unselect

classitems.description:
Returns a string representation of the combined text content of all the
ranges in this selection.
classitems.name: toString

return.description:
String representation of the combined text content of all
    the ranges in this selection.

classitems.description: CSS class names used by this treeview.
classitems.name: classNames

subprops.name: canHaveChildren
subprops.description:
Class name indicating that a tree node can
    contain child nodes (whether or not it actually does).

subprops.name: children
subprops.description: Class name for a list of child nodes.

subprops.name: hasChildren
subprops.description:
Class name indicating that a tree node has one
    or more child nodes.

subprops.name: icon
subprops.description: Class name for a tree node's icon.

subprops.name: indicator
subprops.description: Class name for an open/closed indicator.

subprops.name: label
subprops.description: Class name for a tree node's user-visible label.

subprops.name: node
subprops.description: Class name for a tree node item.

subprops.name: noTouch
subprops.description:
Class name added to the TreeView container when not
    using a touchscreen device.

subprops.name: open
subprops.description: Class name indicating that a tree node is open.

subprops.name: row
subprops.description:
Class name for a row container encompassing the
    indicator and label within a tree node.

subprops.name: selected
subprops.description: Class name for a tree node that's selected.

subprops.name: touch
subprops.description:
Class name added to the TreeView container when using
    a touchscreen device.

subprops.name: treeview
subprops.description: Class name for the TreeView container.

classitems.description: Whether or not this TreeView has been rendered.
classitems.name: rendered

classitems.description: Default templates used to render this TreeView.
classitems.name: templates

classitems.description: Simple way to type-check that this is a TreeView instance.
classitems.name: _isYUITreeView

classitems.description: Cached value of the `lazyRender` attribute.
classitems.name: _lazyRender

classitems.description:
Returns the HTML node (as a `Y.Node` instance) associated with the specified
`Tree.Node` instance, if any.
classitems.name: getHTMLNode

return.description:
`Y.Node` instance associated with the given tree node, or
    `undefined` if one was not found.

classitems.description:
Renders this TreeView into its container.

If the container hasn't already been added to the current document, it will
be appended to the `<body>` element.
classitems.name: render

classitems.description:
Renders the children of the specified tree node.

If a container is specified, it will be assumed to be an existing rendered
tree node, and the children will be rendered (or re-rendered) inside it.
classitems.name: renderChildren

params.name: treeNode
params.description: Tree node whose children should be rendered.

props.name: container
props.description:
`Y.Node` instance of a container into
        which the children should be rendered. If the container already
        contains rendered children, they will be re-rendered in place.

return.description: `Y.Node` instance containing the rendered children.

classitems.description:
Renders the specified tree node and its children (if any).

If a container is specified, the rendered node will be appended to it.
classitems.name: renderNode

props.name: container
props.description:
`Y.Node` instance of a container to
        which the rendered tree node should be appended.

props.name: renderChildren
props.description:
Whether or not to render
        this node's children.

return.description: `Y.Node` instance of the rendered tree node.

classitems.description:
Setter for the `lazyRender` attribute.

Just caches the value in a property for faster lookups.
classitems.name: _setLazyRender

return.description: Value.

classitems.description:
When `true`, a node's children won't be rendered until the first time
that node is opened.

This can significantly speed up the time it takes to render a large
tree, but might not make sense if you're using CSS that doesn't hide the
contents of closed nodes.
classitems.name: lazyRender
